title: Requires the establishment of distinctive plates for licensed doctors of osteopathy
summary: Requires the establishment of distinctive plates for licensed doctors of osteopathy.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          981

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. PHEFFER, CLARK, SCHIMMINGER -- Multi-Sponsored by
         -- M. of A. BOYLAND, GOTTFRIED, JAFFEE, MAYERSOHN, PERRY, J. RIVERA --
         read once and referred to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to establishing
         distinctive license plates for licensed doctors of osteopathy

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The vehicle and traffic law is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 404-x to read as follows:
    3    S  404-X.    DISTINCTIVE PLATES FOR LICENSED DOCTORS OF OSTEOPATHY. 1.
    4  ANY DOCTOR OF OSTEOPATHY LICENSED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED  THIR-
    5  TY-ONE  OF  THE  EDUCATION  LAW  AND  RESIDING IN THIS STATE SHALL, UPON
    6  REQUEST, BE ISSUED A  DISTINCTIVE  LICENSE  PLATE  BEARING  THE  LETTERS
    7  "D.O."   ON THE LICENSE PLATE'S FACE TO THE RIGHT OF SUCH PLATE'S REGIS-
    8  TERED NUMBER AND THE TERM "PHYSICIAN" AT THE BOTTOM OF THE FACE  OF  THE
    9  LICENSE  PLATE.    A  DISTINCTIVE  PLATE  ISSUED TO A LICENSED DOCTOR OF
   10  OSTEOPATHY PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL NOT BE ISSUED TO THE SPOUSE OF
   11  SUCH DOCTOR. APPLICATION FOR SUCH DISTINCTIVE  LICENSE  PLATE  SHALL  BE
   12  FILED  WITH THE COMMISSIONER IN SUCH FORM AND DETAIL AS THE COMMISSIONER
   13  SHALL PRESCRIBE, AND SHALL BE VERIFIED ANNUALLY BY THE APPLICANT.
   14    2. THE DISTINCTIVE PLATE AUTHORIZED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION
   15  SHALL BE ISSUED UPON PROOF, SATISFACTORY TO THE COMMISSIONER,  THAT  THE
   16  APPLICANT  IS  A DOCTOR OF OSTEOPATHY LICENSED TO PRACTICE IN THIS STATE
   17  PURSUANT TO ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-ONE OF THE EDUCATION LAW.
   18    3. A DISTINCTIVE PLATE ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE ISSUED
   19  IN THE SAME MANNER AS OTHER NUMBER PLATES UPON PAYMENT  OF  THE  REGULAR
   20  REGISTRATION  FEE PRESCRIBED BY SECTION FOUR HUNDRED ONE OF THIS ARTICLE
   21  AND A ONE-TIME ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHARGE OF TWENTY-FIVE DOLLARS  CHARGED
   22  FOR  SUCH PLATE.  SUCH SERVICE CHARGE SHALL BE DEPOSITED PURSUANT TO THE
   23  PROVISIONS OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED FOUR-OO OF THIS ARTICLE TO THE CREDIT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00725-01-1

       A. 981                              2

    1  OF THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES DISTINCTIVE PLATE  DEVELOPMENT  FUND
    2  ESTABLISHED  BY SECTION NINETY-FIVE-G OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW AND SHALL
    3  BE USED FOR PRODUCTION, DESIGN, ADVERTISING AND MARKETING OF DISTINCTIVE
    4  LICENSE PLATES PURSUANT TO SUCH SECTION NINETY-FIVE-G.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
    6  it  shall  have  become a law; provided, that any rules, regulations and
    7  actions necessary to implement the provisions of this act on its  effec-
    8  tive  date are authorized and directed to be completed on or before such
    9  date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to establishing distinctive license plates for licensed doctors of osteopathy
